intro: Hieracium cacuminatum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium cacuminatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
